Uses of Interface
net.uniform.api.Element

  • Packages that use Element 
    Package Description
    net.uniform.api  
    net.uniform.html.decorators  
    net.uniform.html.elements  
    net.uniform.html.renderers

    • Uses of Element in net.uniform.api

      Classes in net.uniform.api with type parameters of type Element 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  Renderer<T extends Element>
      A Renderer is responsible of generating the HTML tags that represent a single Element.
      interface  Validator<T extends Element>
      A validator can be added to an Element to extend its validation logic.
      Subinterfaces of Element in net.uniform.api 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  ElementWithValueConversion<T>
      This interface extends an Element features so it's able to override the conversion of its String values to any target type with any custom logic.
      Methods in net.uniform.api that return Element 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Element Element.addDecorator(Decorator decorator)
      Adds a decorator to the element, to be used in the render() method.
      Element Element.addFilter(Filter filter)
      Adds a filter to be used when setting or populating a value to this element.
      Element Element.addValidator(Validator validator)
      Adds a validator to the element, to be used in the getValidationErrors() method.
      Element Element.clearDecorators()
      Removes all decorators from this element.
      Element Element.clearFilters()
      Removes all filters from this element.
      Element Element.clearValidation()
      Sets the validation performed status of this element to false.
      Element Element.clearValidators()
      Removes all validators from the element.
      Element Form.getElement(String id)
      Returns an element previously added to the form by id.
      Element Element.populate(List<String> value)
      Sets the list of values to be hold by the element.
      Element Element.removeDecorator(Decorator decorator)
      Removes a decorator of this element, if present.
      Element Element.removeFilter(Filter filter)
      Removes a filter from this element.
      Element Element.removeProperty(String key)
      Removes a property of the element by key.
      Element Element.removeValidator(Validator validator)
      Removes a validator from the element, if existing.
      Element Element.reset()
      Resets the values and validation state of the element.
      Element Element.setDecorators(List<Decorator> decorators)
      Replaces the list of decorators of this element.
      Element Element.setDescription(String description)
      Sets the description of the element.
      Element Element.setFilters(List<Filter> filters)
      Replaces the list of filters of this element.
      Element Element.setLabel(String label)
      Sets the label of the element.
      Element Element.setProperty(String key, String value)
      Sets the value of a property of the element by key.
      Element Element.setRenderer(Renderer renderer)
      Sets the renderer to be used by this element in the render() method.
      Element Element.setRequired()
      Sets the required flag of this element to true.
      Element Element.setRequired(boolean required)
      Sets the required flag of this element to the given value.
      Element Element.setTranslationEnabled()
      Enables the element label and description translation.
      Element Element.setTranslationEnabled(boolean enable)
      Enables or disables the element label and description translation.
      Element Element.setValidators(List<Validator> validators)
      Replaces all validators of the element with a new list of validators.
      Element Element.setValue(List<String> value)
      Sets the list of values to be hold by the element.
      Element Element.setValue(String value)
      Sets a single value to be hold by the element.
      Methods in net.uniform.api that return types with arguments of type Element 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Map<String,Element> Form.getElements()
      Returns an index of all elements in this form indexed by id.
      Methods in net.uniform.api with parameters of type Element 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Form Form.addElement(Element element)
      Adds an element to the form.
      Form Form.addElement(Element element, boolean useDefaultDecorators)
      Adds an element to the form.
      Form Form.addElements(boolean useDefaultDecorators, Element... elements)
      Adds several elements doing the same as Form.addElement(net.uniform.api.Element, boolean) method.
      Form Form.addElements(Element... elements)
      Adds several elements doing the same as Form.addElement(net.uniform.api.Element) method.
      Form Form.removeElement(Element element)
      Removes an element from the form.
      Method parameters in net.uniform.api with type arguments of type Element 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Form Form.addDefaultDecoratorForElementClass(Class<? extends Element> clazz, Decorator decorator)
      Adds a default decorator for the given element class, to be used when adding elements to the form without any decorators.
      List<Decorator> Form.getDefaultDecoratorsAppliedToElementClass(Class<? extends Element> clazz)
      If the element class or superclasses decorators has been explicitely set with Form.addDefaultDecoratorForElementClass(java.lang.Class, net.uniform.api.Decorator), this returns a list of decorators, otherwise returns null.
      List<Decorator> Form.getDefaultDecoratorsForElementClass(Class<? extends Element> clazz)
      Returns the default decorators set for the given element class.
      Renderer Form.getDefaultRendererAppliedToElementClass(Class<? extends Element> clazz)
      If the element class or superclasses renderer has been explicitely set with Form.setDefaultRendererForElementClass(java.lang.Class, net.uniform.api.Renderer), this returns a renderer, otherwise returns null.
      Renderer Form.getDefaultRendererForElementClass(Class<? extends Element> clazz)
      Returns the default renderer set for the given element class.
      Form Form.removeDefaultDecoratorsForElementClass(Class<? extends Element> clazz)
      Removes any specific default decorators configuration for the given element class in this form, if existing.
      Form Form.removeDefaultRendererForElementClass(Class<? extends Element> clazz)
      Removes any specific default render configuration for the given element class in this form, if existing.
      List<SimpleHTMLTag> Decorator.render(Form form, List<Element> elements, List<SimpleHTMLTag> rendered)
      Decorate the previously generated HTML.
      Form Form.setDefaultDecoratorsForElementClass(Class<? extends Element> clazz, List<Decorator> decorators)
      Replaces the default decorators list for the given element class, to be used when adding elements to the form without any decorators.
      Form Form.setDefaultRendererForElementClass(Class<? extends Element> clazz, Renderer renderer)
      Sets a default renderer for the given element class, to be used when adding elements to the form without a renderer.

    • Uses of Element in net.uniform.html.elements

      Classes in net.uniform.html.elements that implement Element 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Button
      Element that represents an HTML Button.
      class  Checkbox
      Element that represents an HTML checkbox.
      class  DatePicker
      Element that represents an HTML date picker with the default HTML5 date format.
      class  Hidden
      Element that represents a hidden HTML element.
      class  HTMLElement
      Help element that is able to render any SimpleHTMLTag.
      class  Input
      Element that represents any input HTML element.
      class  Multicheckbox
      Element that represents a group of checkboxes with the same name, similar to a Multiselect element.
      class  Multiselect
      Element that represents a HTML select with multiple values selection.
      class  Radio
      Element that represents a list of HTML radio elements in a group (same name).
      class  Select
      Element that represents a HTML select with single value selection.
      class  Textarea
      Element that represents a HTML textarea.

    • Uses of Element in net.uniform.impl

      Classes in net.uniform.impl that implement Element 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  AbstractElement
      Abstract element implementation that contains all generic logic that any element should have.
      class  AbstractHTMLElement
      Default HTML element implementation.
      class  ElementWithOptions
      Abstract element implementation that contains all generic logic that any element with options should have.
      class  MultioptionInputElement
      Implementation of an abstract element with multiple options based on HTML <input> tags such as Multicheckbox and Radio.
